personal.name: Patrick Chen
personal.title: IT developer
personal.bio: Passionate with expertise in development, machine learning, and data science. Experienced in building scalable applications and implementing solutions.

description: Languages ​​Used: HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and Python

During my internship, I developed websites by integrating CSS layouts and performed web scraping processes in Python, extracting structured data from links while taking into account the CSS structure of the pages.
Languages ​​used: HTML, CSS, JavaScript and JSON/liquid

During my internship, I collaborated on the development of the company's main website on Shopify, designing interactive mockups, integrating essential features via Liquid and JavaScript, and optimizing the UX/UI to improve performance and user interaction.
Languages ​​used: TypeScript, SQL, Next.js 15 (App Router) / React 18, Drizzle ORM, Tailwind CSS, Node.js, npm/yarn/pnpm

During this internship, I participated in the implementation of innovative solutions around the intelligent management of products without data history, by designing methods to optimize their processing despite the absence of pre-existing data. I also contributed to the creation of dynamic and customizable dashboards, adapted to user roles in order to improve the experience and decision-making. This project was carried out using the latest web technologies, including Next.js for front-end/back-end integration, and Drizzle as a modern ORM for efficient database management.

projects.name: DNA Sequence Analysis Development
projects.description: Designed and implemented bioinformatics algorithms for codon detection and identification, using nucleotide sequence analysis and DNA motif recognition techniques.

projects.name: Automated Cash Register System
projects.description: Collaborated in a team of 5 to develop an automated cash register system featuring a dynamic control interface, responsive design, and backend processing.

projects.name: Multimodal Car Selection Application
projects.description: Developed a multimodal application for car selection using Next.js for the frontend, Java for a REST API, MongoDB as the NoSQL database, and Python for data initialization and population. Enabled dynamic vehicle filtering via the API.
